snippet: San Francisco's tax-cutting Proposition E, backed by the venture capitalist Ron Conway, passed with a resounding 70 percent of votes. It was among the most prominent examples of the technology sector's flexing its political muscle in city affairs.
abstract: San Francisco's tax-cutting Proposition E, backed by the venture capitalist Ron Conway, passed with a resounding 70 percent of votes. It was among the most prominent examples of the technology sector's flexing its political muscle in city affairs.

headline.main: San Francisco Tech Companies Win a Proposition to Save on Taxes
